Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Dexmedetomidine Sedation in Peripheral Nerve Block Surgery for Diabetic Foot Ulcer and Chronic Limb-Threatening Ischemia

Participants.evidence: This single-center, retrospective observational study included 18 patients undergoing peripheral nerve block with dexmedetomidine.

Intervention.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of dexmedetomidine sedation during peripheral nerve block surgery in these patients.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of dexmedetomidine sedation during peripheral nerve block surgery in these patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative stress, measured on a 6-point scale.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean intraoperative stress score was 0.72, and the mean intraoperative memory score was 2.44.

Harms.evidence: One patient experienced bradycardia, and 9 had hypoxemia, all resolved by adjusting dexmedetomidine dosage and encouraging deep breathing.
